column1: date{"content"{"rating"{"name"{"number"{"sqft"{"occ"{"subfree"{"numrooms"{"floor"{"bathroom"
2006-03-09{"Scully has air conditioning
column2: which is nice.  My \"conjoined single\" setup was fantastic because the person in the connected single was my best friend.  We share a bathroom
column3: which is something I would not want to do with any more than one roommate.  Freshman year
column4: I was in a 7-guy suite with a shared bathroom
column5: and it was GROSS.  Sharing a bathroom with just one other guy can work.  Basically
column6: this room has an inner closet/hallway thing that connects the two singles (it's not considered a double because we  each have our own door to the main building hallway
column7: and we each have our own phone number and address).  The closet/hallway/bathroom connector is really cool cuz you can pile lots of stuff in there and try to keep your bedroom relatively organized.  The absolute worst part of Scully is that it is so far from everything.  10 minute walk to Colonial Club.  Location is important to me
column8: so this was definitely a drawback.  Still
column9: everything considered
column10: I was happy having Scully 152 for my senior year
column11: given that I was connected to my best bud."{"4"{"Witherspoon"{"516"{"122"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"5"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"A177 used to be part of the assistant master's suite. The closet is really large because it was a kitchen once. I lived in the room the first year after it was converted into a dorm
column2: and it was a 5-man affair that year. Even with 5 guys we had a lot of room
column3: so I imagine it's pretty spacious as a quad.

column1: The location is pretty atrocious though - as far as possible from all of campus. If you don't mind that fact
column2: then this is a pretty decent room."{"4"{"Witherspoon"{"115"{"190"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"1"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"The room is ADA compliant
column2: which means it has a very large bathroom
column3: a fairly big shower with a seat in it
column4: and a low peep-hole. You basically have to know what people are wearing in order to tell who it is outside your door. The usable living space in the room itself (outside the bathroom) is a lot smaller than that of most of the other doubles in the main inn. Also
column5: the ceiling is quite low--I have a loft
column6: and I sleep about 2 feet away from the ceiling. I cannot sit up in bed
column7: and I hit my head a LOT; if you draw into 312 Forbes
column8: I would not recommend lofting your bed
column9: even though you might want to in order to free up some space in this rather small room. Some positives are that the room has a great view of the golf course and two closets built into the wall (instead of the armoires that some rooms have). Also
column10: the hallway-type space leading into the room is wide enough to put your dresser and/or fridge in
column11: to free up some space in the main area of the room. All told
column12: I have been fine living in 312 Forbes this year
column13: but would have preferred most other doubles in the main inn over this one. "{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"112"{"104"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"1"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"While the 134 sq feet might lead you to think its a small room
column2: it actually feels MUCH larger than any of the rooms on the first through third floors.  This is because the ceiling is about 19 ft high
column3: which makes it feel spacious.  The windows in Scully are small but the southern exposure of the room means it gets plenty of daylight. I am rating this a  good room because it's probably one of the best singles if you're looking in Scully.  It's also down the hall from the laundry room and elevator
column4: and next to a stairwell
column5: which is unbeatable."{"4"{"Witherspoon"{"121"{"115"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"1"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"This room is a decently sized double
column2: the bathroom is upstairs for guys
column3: it has a small closet
column4: just your basic 1 room double.  Nothing special about it"{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"208"{"108"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"dont be fooled by the large square footage of this room
column2: its in an awkward shape.  The room is shaped like an L.  This has advantages and disadvantages.  My roomate and I got lofts which opened up a lot more space for things like a futon and tv"{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"206"{"109"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"Since the girls bathroom is right across the hall it is ideal for girls.
The room is really big!
Only downside is the window faces the walkway that people use coming back from the street at night.  If you like quiet on Thurs and Sat nights you may not get it.  Eventually
column2: you get used to it though plus you hear some really funny
column3: entertaining conversations."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"205"{"212"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"Not only is the room huge
column2: it also has 5 windows (on two walls)
column3: a fireplace with a nice mantle
column4: new light fixtures
column5: and a thermostat. This room was clearly once a double; there are two wardrobes and plenty of electical outlets. The only downside is that the wardrobes' being screwed into the wall limits one's ability to rearrange furniture.

column1: The room also has great noise isolation from the downstairs quads (typically party rooms)
column2: though not from either the quad or triple on its hall. Restrooms for both sexes are near
column3: but that proximity presents no problems (only convenience)."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"217"{"618"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"Real nice room. Quite a large common room with a floor to ceiling book case on one wall. A 4 compartment wooden chest and a shoe shelf/laundry shelf help with storage. Large deck (although I guess one is not supposed to use it). Bathroom about 2 feet from room and since the place is a turret the only rooms on the floor is 141 and the bathroom. Only draw back is the 5 flights of steps with no elevator. "{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"204"{"180"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"
2006-03-09{"Overall I like this room a lot. However
column2: it is a bit small and can be come cramped at times (although I do have a small couch!)."{"4"{"Witherspoon"{"215"{"212"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"I had this room my sophomore year
column2: and it was a great time. It is a two room triple with a little entry way thingy and a bathroom. The entry is mostly wasted space
column3: but you can probably fit some fridges or shelves in there. The bathroom is pretty nice - it's big
column4: there are two sinks
column5: and the shower has an actual door.

column1: We moved all the beds into the smaller room
column2: and made the larger one a common room. This was pretty sweet because the larger room has access to the roof over the auxiliary dining hall through the window.

column1: All in all a decent triple in Forbes - not quite as large as the New Wing ones
column2: but pretty sweet regardless."{"4"{"Witherspoon"{"203"{"619"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"This room is small for a double.  My roommate and I could not fit everything we needed (e.g. clothing)in the space provided. The water fountain across the hall was very convenient
column2: until someone threw up into it
column3: and the mess wasn't cleaned up for three days. (Horribly disgusting.)  Also
column4: when people smoke under the archway
column5: the smoke gets into the room.

column1: The few perks: You're directly over the heating system in the basement
column2: so you'll never need to turn on your heater during the winter. Also
column3: for the 06-07 school year
column4: RCAs Steve and Raj will be one room over in 211
column5: and they are *amazing*"{"2"{"Witherspoon"{"201"{"510"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"If you are going to be stuck on the fourth floor of the forbes addition
column2: it might as well be in one of the doubles.  They reasonably sized and provide a couple options for set up.  Not bad
column3: but just far as hell from campus."{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"211"{"209"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"This is the room where the Feinberg
column2: Wilson Residential College Advisor lives
column3: so non-RCA's can't draw into it."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"122"{"243"{"1"{"0"{"2"{"1"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"For some reason this triple on the fourth floor seems bigger than the other three-room triples in Dod.  There is enough room to move around the beds in the bedrooms.  There is a lot of closet space.  There are no insects in this room
column2: like rooms in other old buildings.  On the negative side
column3: the floor is not level when you enter the room
column4: and the sun shines blindingly into the common room in the afternoon.  Overall a great room in a great building."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"309"{"214"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"This room is huge
column2: and somewhat apartment like. There are two rooms that are definetly meant to be singles. There are also two rooms that work as a double or a common room
column3: or both as singles. One of the two rooms definetly should be either a double or single as it is long and narrow and doesn't work well as a common room. There is also a closet for this room. Overall a great room! (As far from laundry as you can get in Scully though)"{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"308"{"112"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"I lived here my sophomore year and loved it. So the pluses: The room gets morning sunlight
column2: has a gorgeous view onto the golf course
column3: and is pretty quiet at night. The size of the room is also quite nice
column4: and it is located close to a woman's bathroom and the kitchen (so all very convenient).

column1: The negatives: It is directly across from the staircase
column2: which is not a problem in regard to people coming in/out (Forbes isn't that frequented) but an issue when the door-being-propped-open-too-long sound goes off (which happened quite frequently). When I lived there
column3: the heating was also extremely loud. I've been in rooms in Brown
column4: Murray-Dodge that also have loud heating
column5: but this was louder. The sound was more of a shrill high sound with big clunking sounds (I learned to sleep throught it). The Forbes addition is also more disconnected from the rest of Forbes (and farther away from campus
column6: although once you make it to Forbes
column7: I don't think the difference is that great).

column1: I would highly recommend this room to those who are looking for a quiet space
column2: like to wake up to the morning sun
column3: and enjoy the single life (living with friends nearby is also a way to have the best of the social and solitary worlds)."{"4"{"Witherspoon"{"306"{"113"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"First floor
column2: women's and men's single occupant bathrooms 6 feet away
column3: lots of space and a big window. Laundry room
column4: computer cluster and kitchen down one flight of stairs. Central location
column5: close to Dillon
column6: UStore
column7: Firestone
column8: relatively close to Frist. Heating not adjustable
column9: only on/off - radiator along one wall. Sometimes a bit cold in winter."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"305"{"220"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"This room has a great location
column2: right in the middle of campus and is on the first floor. The common room is nice and big
column3: and there are lots of windows looking out over the little quad across from Dillon gym. It's really close to the women's bathroom (and the men's) which can be tough in this building.

column1: The only downsides are that we had a bunch of birds in our chimney (6 over the first semester) that got caught inside and died
column2: but it hasn't happened in a while so we think they may have patched it up.

column1: Also
column2: the single and the double are the same size
column3: making it a little tight in the double (with only 1 closet.) "{"4"{"Witherspoon"{"317"{"654"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"Minus the location this is an excellent single with great light
column2: a view of the golf course and plenty of room. Better than 90% of the Main Inn singles if you can deal with having a bathroom right next door instead of in your room."{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"304"{"189"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"One of the turret rooms in Spoon.  Only on the 2nd floor so no elevator or long walks up the stairs.  The common room is amazing and the turret serves as a nice bar/dining area.  The rooms are a bit narrow
column2: but it's still an amazing room overall."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"303"{"650"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"Yeah it's decently sized
column2: but one of the bedrooms only half the size of the other.  There's some built in shelves and cupboards
column3: and a nice walk landing to walk out on... but this room is really old
column4: falling apart
column5: filled with cockroaches and bedbugs
column6: and it makes really loud sounds when the heater turns on.  I really disliked the room and got placed in it on waitlist."{"2"{"Witherspoon"{"314"{"109"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-09{"204 Forbes is not a bad room. It's a little on the small side
column2: for a Forbes room
column3: I guess
column4: and it was difficult to find a good furniture arrangement after debunking the beds... and there's only one real closet (the other one is a wardrobe that you can't move out of the corner).... and the bathroom flooded once
column5: and the heater practically exploded.... but not a bad room overall. Good central location (close to the central stairs)."{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"301"{"529"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"I've adored living in this room.  All the singles in the Annex are huge
column2: but there are a few things about this one that make it special.  There is a beautiful view of the golf course
column3: and lots of sun  in the morning.  Big windows make the room easy to ventilate.  The girls' bathroom is only a few doors down (but far enough that the beeping of the door lock isn't bothersome)
column4: although mens' restrooms are a slightly farther walk to either side.  The room is also slightly trapezoidal - a fact that doesn't improve or reduce the quality or the room
column5: but is a point of interest.  I would recommend this room to anybody...I wish I could live here again next year!"{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"410"{"114"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"4"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"Actually two rooms -- no private bathroom -- and upwards of 200 square feet.
Floor plans are wrong
column2: the bathroom is actually a second little room
column3: which I made into a bedroom and had the main room as a TV/couch living space."{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"411"{"223"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"4"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-11{"This is a fantastic room. In addition to having a spacious common room and a first floor location
column2: it's directly above the laundry room
column3: the Blair printer
column4: and Blair cafe. You don't need go outside for any of that stuff. Minor flaws include: the bathroom is upstairs
column5: one of the bedrooms is a decent amount larger than the other
column6: and neither of the bedrooms is particularly big. All in all
column7: though
column8: I couldn't have expected much more. Take it if you have the chance."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"409"{"219"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"4"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"This room is great. Lots of space in the common room. We have 2 couches
column2: a recliner
column3: a TV
column4: and a bar in there. the bedrooms have plenty of room for beds and desks. The bathroom is 2 doors down
column5: the laundry is right downstairs
column6: as is the printer. All in all
column7: it is quite room to live in. "{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"408"{"114"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"4"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"pretty much all singles in the standard wilson buildings are essentially the same.
this one is on the small side
column2: and up three flights of stairs.

column1: i liked the view north to the courtyard just below prospect garden.
it's really not a bad room.  pretty standard.  i've enjoyed it."{"4"{"Witherspoon"{"405"{"231"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"4"{"PU"
2007-11-27{"This room has a VERY nice view of the golf course - it's something worth waking up to.
It may have more square footage than neighboring rooms
column2: but the room is weirdly shaped such that so much square footage is lost to corners. Theres a cove in one corner of the room that can hold a desk
column3: but then it makes the rest of the area around it useless. It'd be impossible to debunk the beds and VERY cramped to get a futon in there.

column1: However you do share a bathroom with room 209
column2: and it's pretty fun since it's almost as if you have a quad. It's also useful if you forget your key and your roommate's not around - you can just go in through their door :)."{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"417"{"659"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"4"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"A nice room
column2: girl's bathroom next door and boy's bathroom upstairs.  The room is spacious
column3: but in a long
column4: skinny sort of way.  Bad cell phone reception and sometimes noisy from the dance studio in Dillon Gym
column5: which the windows face.  In a sea of sorority girls."{"4"{"Witherspoon"{"404"{"191"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"4"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"One-room Double with private bathroom. Not quite enough space for two beds and two desks
column2: so we ditched the second desk and and unstacked the beds. Window faces northeast
column3: so it doesn't get great light
column4: but it will get you up in the morning. Privacy is assured because the branches of the tree in front of Forbes come right up to the window. This year the heat went out periodically
column5: but that should be fixed for next year. The overhead light isn't great
column6: but a few floor lamps take care of that.

column1: It's right next to the elevator
column2: for those of you who are afraid of stairs.

column1: The neighboring rooms are similar
column2: but preferable: 201 has a small window in its bathroom and is slightly larger
column3: 215 and 216 are similar in size but face southwest
column4: with great light all day long.

column1: This year 202 was in substance free housing. If you have a late draw time
column2: this part of sub-free doesn't go early
column3: and you get to have a decent location instead of the Annex."{"4"{"Witherspoon"{"403"{"650"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"4"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"So my roommates and I had the sixth draw time in the non-independent senior room draw. (This room usually goes in the independent draw
column2: but we lucked out.) We ended up choosing this quad over the ones in Dod because of the space  each one of us has a single
column3: but two are so big that one could be a double leaving a nice common room. And there's a huge (by Princeton standards)private bathroom and even the hallway's roomy. The location (north wing Scully) is fine too
column4: only 2 mins from Frist
column5: just as close as from Brown
column6: though I have a bike for trips to Nassau. You also have the Scully amenities like air-co
column7: elevators
column8: tv room and a kitchen two floors down. Only minus for independent folks is that there's no kitchen in the room. All-in-all I'm really happy with it."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"414"{"110"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"4"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"Once Butler is gone
column2: this will be one of the worst rooms on campus
column3: and it is already one of the worst in Forbes.

column1: It is very small -- without bunked beds you'll have no room to manuever.
It is located in the Forbes island
column2: which is the grouping of rooms farthest from campus (farthest down Alexander Street).

column1: Unless you want to take a winding route through the entire Forbes addition
column2: you have to go outside to get to the dining hall (not the case in other regions of Forbes).

column1: Since it is on the second floor
column2: you have to go downstairs to reach any other part of Forbes (also not the case anywhere else in Forbes).

column1: Its one good quality is that it's in a quiet location
column2: because no comes to the Forbes island...ever."{"1"{"Witherspoon"{"104"{"593"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"1"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"My only complaints about this room are the location being far away from campus
column2: and the occaisional loud noise due to thin doors and a bathroom nearby.

column1: Otherwise:
1) It's pretty big.
2) It's nice and new and clean.
3) 3 good windows with a view of poe field.
4) Right down the hall from laundry.
5) Right near both bathrooms.
6) Oh yeah
column2: the best part is the ceiling.  It's ridiculously high.  Like 15 feet high.  You could build an incredible loft in this room and double your usable space
column3: if you were ambitious.

column1: This is one of the best rooms in Ellipse/Bloomberg
column2: other than the really huge ones
column3: although those ones don't have the awesome ceiling like this one does."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"6"{"169"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"0"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"Not a very good room.  The only thing good I really have to say about it is the location of Dod is great.
Despite being recently renovated
column2: it's not all that clean or nice and has issues with bugs crawling in through the woodwork.

column1: The tiny size and awkward shape make this just about the worst single in the whole building.  Not that the others are much better.
It's right next to the men's bathroom but luckily I can't hear much of what's going on in there through the wall.  Neighbors being noisy is sometimes an issue.
It's high enough (3rd floor) that noise from Elm drive or any dumpsters is not a problem at all.
The one window is big and provides decent light but it doesn't function very well."{"2"{"Witherspoon"{"515"{"227"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"5"{"PU"
2006-03-09{"Overall a good
column2: spacious room
column3: although close location next to the entryway means you'll hear people coming back in
column4: late at night
column5: as well as the voice alarm if someone doesn't fully close the door.  Convenient location with regard to Frist
column6: science lab buildings
column7: and most sports practices.  "{"4"{"Witherspoon"{"510"{"116"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"5"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-11{"This room was a bit small though definitely not the smallest of the Wilson singles.  It felt really cramped but I may just never have figured out the best layout.  I moved the chest of drawers into the closet (which is a good size)--it doesn't quite fit perfectly but it works and it's better to get it out of the room itself I think.  Nice view of the quad.  Two doors down from women's bathroom.  Laundry room is in another building (usually I use the Clapp basement laundry room)."{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"511"{"226"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"5"{"PU"
2006-03-09{"Although this room is small

column3: being on the first floor made it noticably cooler in August."{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"509"{"224"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"5"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"Two-room double

column1: The \"balcony\" refers to the fire escape outside the common room window

column1: 2006-03-09{"two closets

column4: extra furniture

column1: 2006-03-10{"Very spacious.  Right above Laundry room

column3: and kitchen!  Next door to girls' bathroom."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"505"{"233"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"5"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"Huge room
column2: great location"{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"517"{"665"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"5"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"Was incredibly lucky to get this room in the fall of 2004. It's a bi-level quad -- the 2nd floor is the 2nd bedroom. The bedrooms aren't too big
column2: but the common room is very big."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"504"{"197"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"5"{"PU"

column4: so you can always hear people going in and out of it."{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"503"{"657"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"5"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"If your considering getting a single a room this one is a great choice.  I would suggest drawing with a couple other people you know who also want singles so that you can all live close to each other on the same floor.  One really great thing about the room is that it's right across from the girl's bathroom which was very convenient.  The room is small but as long as you bring storage bins and keep oversized applicances and furniture under control it'll work for you."{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"514"{"115"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"5"{"PU"
2006-03-10{"This room is great
column2: either as a double or as a single.  I have it as a single and it has plenty of space in the bedroom.  The common room is about the same size as the bedroom
column3: but it is big enough for a futon
column4: two chairs
column5: a tv
column6: fridge and some bookcases.  The worst part about the room is that the closet is in the common room."{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"512"{"116"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"5"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"I've had 2 years here as an RA
column2: and it is without question the best room in Mathey. To whoever gets it--enjoy!"{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"501"{"532"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"5"{"PU"

column1: 2007-11-27{"really close to guy's bathroom...really far from girls' bathroom...ladies
column2: be prepared to use the boys' bathroom

column1: Overall
2007-11-27{"This room has 4 moderately spacious singles
column2: a large and spacious hallway
column3: and a private restroom. Alternatively
column4: you might want to put two people in one room and leave the 4th for a common room.

column1: The rooms are for the most part brightly lit
column2: the floors are wooden and gorgeous
column3: and each single has its own air conditioning control. The windows are huge. I have 9 windows in my single.

column1: Housing in Bloomberg tends to have really crappy sound insulation because every door has about an inch and a half gap between it and the floor
column2: but this problem is easily fixed by adding a little plastic strip on the bottom of the door. This has been done for the doors in 381.

column1: You should know that the showers in 381
column4: and 481 are all on a different waterline from the rest of Bloomberg
column5: which results in our occasionally having to wait upwards of 15 minutes for the hot water to arrive in our shower. In addition
column6: the water pressure generally sucks.

column1: I personally am a huge fan of Bloomberg as a dorm; I firmly believe the insides of Bloomberg make it easily the best dorm on campus. The one thing about it is
column2: of course
column3: the location. The rooms are spacious
column4: beautiful
column5: bug-free
column6: and well-lit; the windows are large and plentiful (the quads mentioned above all have two rooms each with two walls of windows in each room - I watch the sunrise from my bed every morning
column7: and it's spectacular)
column8: and the dorm itself is literally 3 minutes' walk away form the molecular biology buildings. "{"5"{"Witherspoon"{"421"{"122"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"4"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"Decent size common room
column2: but super crowded rooms. Beds have to be bunked and you still don't have a lot of room to do more than stand. All the desks fit into the rooms
column3: but only live here if you are good at putting your clothes away. "{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"416"{"120"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"4"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"large for a double
column2: definately enough space for each roommate to have their own space. Nice built in bookcases

column1: 2007-11-27{"Overall this is a great room for four people to live in very comfortably.  Despite being in the lower third of Wilson quads in terms of square footage

column3: we easily fit the unbunked beds
column4: dressers and desks with ample floor space.  The bedrooms also have large closets with built-in shelves and additional shelves at the ceiling level.  The common room is spacious enough to have a futon
column5: tv
column6: 2 desks
column7: refrigerator and more easily.

column1: 2007-11-27{"This is a fine room . . . I was very happy in it all year.  It's not huge

column1: The room does have a few minor disadvantages. First of all
column2: it's on the parking-lot side of the building.  While I didn't have any problems with noise (it's a quiet parking lot)
column3: there's not a great view.  Also
column4: it gets sunlight in the afternoon (not morning)
column5: and isn't very sunny ever. I think the potted plants I kept in my room would have been happier with a sunnier window. The walls are thin
column6: and you can hear what's happening in other rooms.  But
column7: because it's on a hallway of mostly singles
column8: it tended to be pretty quiet.  There's a bathroom directly down the hallway
column9: but it has only one stall and one shower.  That wasn't much of an inconvenience
column10: though

column1: Overall
column2: I was quite happy with this room."{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"322"{"294"{"1"{"0"{"2"{"3"{"PU"

On the whole I liked this room a lot even though I wouldn't want to live here again next year"{"3"{"Witherspoon"{"221"{"109"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2006-03-10{"I give this a '3' with some reservations.  I was actually reasonably pleased with the room for the year I lived in it.  (I had wanted a single at all costs
column2: and I got one.)  It's just that the room is really

column1: 2007-11-27{"This was my freshman year room.  While it didn't seem terrible

column1: 2007-11-27{"201 Clapp is on the ground floor.  It is just south of the main Wilson courtyard (with volleyball courts) and overlooks the smaller 1938 courtyard.  The laundry room is about 15 feet down the hall and the game room with a pool table is about 15 feet further.

It's easily one of the largest quads available and the room layout is very good.  There are two doubles flanking the main common room with a large and spacious bathroom built in (note: the shower has a foldout seat in it

column1: 2006-03-21{"Wright is of course an amazing building.  It was redone a few years ago so all the furniture in the rooms are new and they're pretty nice.  As far as the location of the room...it's great.  Not far from frist and classes

The printer is one flight right below you and there's actually one washer and dryer literally three steps from the room (and there's a door to close off the laundry room so you don't even hear it).  The room itself isn't super big.  It might be tight as a double

column5: however

column1: 2006-03-21{"I lived in this room last year and I wish I had visited it before we chose it.  While the location is absolutely excellent-there's just a lot of details about the room and building that you should know about before choosing.  On the good side- girls bathroom close by (boys it's a little of a walk) and a printer very near.  Bad- you have to walk all the way to Dod to do your laundry and brown is sort of run down and this room is VERY loud.  You get the noise of people walking back from the street AND the morning dumpster emptying.  While they recently redid the floors so it looks a little nicer
column2: it's still very old.  As far as the room goes-common room was very nice.  The bedrooms are kind of small.  One room is a normal rectangle
column3: which while small- we could fit all our stuff in (Bed's had to be bunked though).  The other bedroom though is the worst part of the room.  It is super awkwardly shaped and doesn't even leave you room for the dressers and desks with the beds bunked.  And to top it all off there's no wardrobes or closets- just one long bar across the back of the room (and the awkardly shaped room only has a tiny bar).  Keep all these details in mind while choosing.  While I enjoyed the room because it was so close to class and the street be prepared to be a bit cramped."{"2"{"Edwards"{"509"{"160"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"5"{"PU"

A LONG way from the street and from athletic facilities if you are an athlete
Steam pipes for the heating system heat the room whether you want it or not- in the middle of winter I'd have the heater off and the windows open and still be sweating.

column1: 2007-11-27{"We drew this room at around noon of the first day of junior draw.  It's square footage is listed as 537

column1: The most notable con about 134 is that one of the two bedrooms is pretty small (the other is very large).  We decided to double loft the beds in that room (with desks below) and it worked out great; i recommend it if you don't mind being in a lofted bed.  We then switched rooms mid-year as the other double is much larger and doesn't require any bunking/lofting.

By double lofting in the smaller room we freed up plenty of space in the common room which is fairly large and has a nice windowsill seat to go along with it.  134 is one of the best locations on campus
column2: with a nice overlook of the junior slums on one side and Dillon gym on the other.  The 13th entryway is right outside the main entrance to Dillon which is pretty convenient

column4: both about 20 feet away (highly convenient).  While there is a dumpster on the slums side of the room
column5: it is not particularly loud and I've only noticed it being unloaded in late morning.

column1: 134 is definitely an excellent quad if you're fine living in a loft (i never had

column1: 2007-11-27{"Lived in this room last year

column1: 2007-11-27{"I really enjoyed living in Scully 318.  Though it's a little bit far from the main part of campus
column2: you get used to the walk pretty easily.  Scully is also a great building--relatively new
column3: and with a lot of nice features
column4: like self-controlled air conditioning and heating.  I especially liked this room
column5: too
column6: since it's right next door to the lounge (with TV)
column7: kitchen (partial
column8: not full: microwave and instant hot water spout
column9: no oven or stovetop)
column10: study room with nice tables (good place to work)
column11: and print release station (just down the hall = SO convenient).  The room is also right by the elevator
column12: which makes moving in and getting to your room super easy.  Note that the third floor of Scully is all connected
column13: whereas the first and second floors aren't--I think this actually makes the third floor of Scully a more desirable place to live than the second floor because of how easily you can get between sections of the building.  Laundry is also close by: either up one floor (directly above you) or down two floors (right below the print release station).  And
column14: if your roommate is hogging the bathroom
column15: there's a bathroom right next door to you (next to the elevator) and the bathrooms on the fourth floor also have additional showers and stalls.  The proximity to the elevator and lounge do not present any noise problems.

column1: In terms of the room itself
column2: it's pretty nice.  The L-shape is a little strange to get used to at first
column3: since the closet is nailed down right next to the door.  However
column4: my roommate and I had quite different setups
column5: and both worked really well: I managed to fit my bed
column6: desk
column7: side table
column8: couch
column9: and bookshelves without a problem

column12: too
column13: although this does cut into your floor space.

column1: The room has a huge window that looks out over Poe Field
column2: which is beautiful
column3: along with high ceilings.  318 is slightly different from most of the other rooms in this part of Scully in that the window ledge is rectangular (as opposed to having the triangular window that sticks out
column4: which I think every other room has).  This means your window is one long flat piece of glass as opposed to two panels that are concave...Though a little bit different at first
column5: and perhaps hard if you're planning on putting a TV there
column6: it's a great shelf and quite easy to put your desk by the window and look out on the beautiful weather outside you.

column1: Having your own bathroom is of course a huge plus
column2: too.

column1: Pick this room with a roommate you like

column1: 2006-03-30{"This room is very cozy because it is in a newly renovated building with thermostats in the room and new hardwood floors and furniture.  It is a comfortably sized room

The other half of the ceiling is particuarly nice because it is really high but the slanted ceiling severly limits where you can put things and either the desk or bed must go under the slant.  Also
column3: the window is in the slanted ceiling and faces north and so there is little light that enters the room although the other lighting in the room is particularly good.  The bed is raised so that is useful for storage and the room has its own thermostat (it just controls the heat

column1: 2007-11-27{"Pros: One of the biggest singles in the building

column1: 2007-11-27{"As a junior
column2: any of the 2 room doubles are about as good as it gets unless you're lucky enough to have an awesome draw time. The guys I was drawing with all wanted singles (as did I)
column3: and even though we didn't have a terrible draw time (middle of the second day)
column4: none of the up campus rooms that we could have drawn into were terribly great. The quads were all small and all the singles were located all over the place. That being said
column5: Scully 2 room doubles have a lot going for them. You have ample space in your room and you get your own private bathroom to share with your roommate as well. There is a little bit of hall space for when you enter the double and then doors leading to each person's individual room. You'll have a toilet and sink to one side of the hall space and a shower and sink on the other. The hall space is big enough that you'll have space for a fridge or shoe rack or crates or whatever else you might like.

column1: One of the great things about scully is the air conditioning. At the beginning and end of the year
column2: while all your friends are sitting around sweating in their rooms
column3: you get to be cool and dry. Also
column4: there's a lot of study rooms scattered throughout the building
column5: so if you need to work on a problem set with other people
column6: you can get them to come down to you rather than trudging your way over to frist or the library. Did I mention that the laundry machines and print cluster are just a floor down from 368? Unlike a lot of other laundry rooms on campus
column7: the laundry room here usually isn't terribly busy. So the days of walking through the rain 2 buildings over with your 3 weeks worth of laundry only to find that none of the machines are available are over.

column1: As for the downside
column2: there are no common rooms really in scully
column3: which means no big parties really. But that's what up campus is for
column4: right? Also
column5: despite having hallways
column6: scully just isn't a terribly lively place. On the flipside
column7: if you're looking for a room that will be fairly quiet
column8: this is it. Finally
column9: scully really does put some physical distance between you and your friends who might live further up campus. At least you're probably just as far away from classes and the street as all of them. The only difference is that you get a little extra exercise trekking up hill.

2007-11-27{"This is by far the best room on campus. If you have 9 other good friends who are up for it and don't mind the sub free status

column6: tables
column7: shelves
column8: etc... just about whatever you want (like a tiki hut). And yes

column1: 2007-11-27{"Unlike the previous review

The best feature of 408 is that it has 5 bedrooms; i.e. 4 singles.  The room is pretty much highly symmetrical; the four singles are essentially identical and the common room and the double are as well.

column1: The singles are by no means huge
column2: but are quite sufficient to live comfortably.  Also
column3: we didn't have an issue with too-thin walls.  I found them adequate; you're more liable to hear through the standard dorm doors than the walls.  The double is somewhat unusually shaped

column6: but we made do just fine and fit in many more on two futons--I think putting the TV(s) in the fireplace area maximizes the number of seats.

column1: 408 was also great for parties given the number of rooms and hallway.  The only issue we had with the room was that the room overlooks Elm
column2: such that it  is easy for Public Safety to hear parties
column3: but they were always pretty chill.

column2: if you're looking for a 5-bedroom 6-man

column1: 2007-11-27{"104 has a very convenient location

column3: and apparently it is the only one that can be turned off on the floor. The main problems lie in how smokers favor standing right outside the entrance and how belligerent drunks favor trashing the lobby area.

column1: 2007-11-27{"As a freshman I basically had a TON of fun in this suite because as one of the only common spaces in 1939
column2: we get visitors all the time which makes for a very  exciting and interesting year. The hall is very close because we spend so much time together.

column1: The first reviewer was extremely accurate
column2: so I will just add on the following:

column1: 1. The pair in the double on the lower level of the suite should be people who go to sleep the latest and who don't mind noise because it opens out right into the common room.
2. If you're reading this review as a pre-frosh
column2: try to figure out who's rooming with whom before getting on campus. It makes moving in a lot easier if everyone already knows who their roommate is and which room they're going to live in. Plus
column3: this way you'll avoid any roommate incompatabilities later in the year. This worked out so well for us that all three of the double pairs in this suite are staying with their roommate for next year.

column1: 3. Lighting is pretty terrible. Be prepared to buy lamps
column2: lots of them.

column1: 4. It'll take trial and error to figure out a cleaning schedule that works. Be patient with one another.
All in all
column2: rejoice if you get this suite. There's so much space and so much fun involved in being with so many people. "{"5"{"Patton"{"86"{"155"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"1"{"PU"

column1: 2007-04-10{"This room theoretically should be a lot of fun
column2: the common room is great.  There is a somewhat awkwardly sized nook with a beautiful window; we had to build a window seat in order to fit the size though.  One major issue with the room is the lack of outlets - there are only 2 in the common room and one in each bedroom.  One double is possibly a third of the size of the other
column3: the smaller double is very difficult to have two people live in (you definitely cannot fit both your desks and dressers in the room).  Also
column4: the heat turned off for the month of January.  Foulke's an old dorm

column1: 2008-02-29{"221 is a somewhat quirky but nice room. We drew this room on the 1st day of junior draw

column1: The common room is quite large and can comfortably fit 3 desks
column2: 3 drawers
column3: a couch
column4: a fridge
column5: and a TV (which we stuffed into the fireplace).  Definitely capable of large parties if you're into it.  Walls are made of concrete/stone and not too susceptible to nailing.  Lighting isn't too great despite windows on 2 walls
column6: because of the way the room is oriented.  Heating (like in most of the slums) is by hand adjusting valves on wall-side boilers.

column1: The real issue is that the bedroom is TINY -- as a triple this year
column2: we could not fit the 3rd bed in the room even after bunking 2 beds
column3: and the 3rd roommate had to resort to piling up mattresses stolen from the hallway.  It'll work much better as a double
column4: although the dimensions of the room compared to the bed frames would still require either bunking or moving one bed into the common room.  There is one built-in closet in the bedroom
column5: and 2 out in the common room.

column1: There is a private bathroom accessible only by walking through the bedroom.  It works fine other than the occasional drainage problem (Housing responded within the day when I called them up).  Although the little bathroom window is located directly beneath the Henry-Foulke archway
column2: which enables eavesdropping during showers.

column1: 2008-03-26{"  The rooms are a little small (beds need to be bunked if you plan to have all desks and dressers in the room) but is completely made up for by the fact that we have a gigantic common room with two huge windows with beautiful views. One window we've kept covered with a Pace (Italian for \"peace\") flag so our activities in the room aren't constantly on display. The other window isn't at eye-level so we get a beautiful view
column2: but no one looking in.

column1: There is no better location on campus. We're first floor
column2: so moving in is a snap. We're closer to Frist than we are to Wilson. There's a computer cluster in nearby 1937. Best of all
column3: laundry is just one flight of stairs down. Being central campus and at the intersection of so many roads
column4: 101 Feinberg is also a great place to meet people
column5: and we have lots of friends stop by the room just because it is on their way to and/or from class
column6: activities
column7: etc.

column1: The room on the right has significantly more natural light
column2: so if this is a major consideration
column3: keep that in mind. Also
column4: your computers will need to be wireless. The ethernet ports are in strange locations and may not work with the layout you want of the room.

column1: The one reservation I have about this room is noise. You will get noise of people walking back from the street. Also
column2: Feinberg is a great place for parties
column3: so don't draw into this room if you expect your neighbors to be completely quiet on a Saturday night. Also
column4: the heaters are water heaters that have a propensity for clanking. It worked out great for us because we're all deep sleepers. We weren't bothered by the noise. This is especially important because it sort of defeats the purpose of having such a great common room if one roommate needs absolute quiet when sleeping. If you're a very private person and can't stand the idea of people being able to see into your common room
column5: then it might not be a such a great idea to draw into this room
column6: either.

column1: However
column2: what are the other perks of this room? Well
column3: there's the prox entry for one. You won't have to carry an extra key with you
column4: you can just prox in! The private bathroom (just make sure you guys are willing to clean it). And
column5: for the 2008-2009 year
column6: your RCAs will be right downstairs in the Fishbowl
column7: so free food and lots of fun whenever you want!

column1: In all seriousness
column2: visit and see for yourselves. I've loved living here and am actually quite bummed that I can't keep living here. You're a lucky person if you draw into this room!"{"5"{"Cuyler"{"434"{"124"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2008-03-26{"While its a fairly large quad
column2: there's not much you can do with it with the numerous protruding pipes and the lack of electrical outlets in the common room.

column1: The bedrooms also have pipes sticking out everywhere
column2: and I have not had one night where the pipes are not continuously making loud and annoying clanging noises.

column1: As well
column2: we've had problems with roaches and mice.  Look elsewhere if you can."{"2"{"Cuyler"{"433"{"152"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2008-03-26{"I'll start off with what's good about this room. It's on the first floor
column2: so no walking up stairs/taking elevators to get to your room. Also
column3: it's close to the trash room and men's bathroom
column4: which is nice. For the most part
column5: this room is...cozy.

column1: Now the bad stuff. It's located on the first floor
column2: which means that if your blinds are open
column3: people can see right into your room. Plus
column4: smokers tend to congregate right outside of this room
column5: which is a problem during the early
column6: hot months of the school year when you've got your windows open. There's lots of noise going on outside with the window with people talking as they walk in and out of the building. Not to mention
column7: the ceiling is thin
column8: and every movement someone upstairs makes sounds like a thud (and if they play any music you can hear it LOUD AND CLEAR). There isn't much space to debunk comfortably
column9: especially if you have a mini-fridge in your room. The corner closet is in an annoying position because there's about a six-inch space between it and the dresser.

column1: On the plus side
column2: this room is pretty great if you're gonna have drunk people (or people in general) sleeping on your floor."{"2"{"Cuyler"{"432"{"164"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"3"{"PU"

column1: 2009-03-24{"This room has one double

column2: being in Joline

column11: so I had to seal it up with duct tape.

column1: 2. In terms of noise

column3: even on party nights.

column1: 3. The bathrooms are close by
column2: but they have extremely poor ventilation
column3: and are inconsistently maintained by the janitor. Although they are better than those found in the basement
column4: they are mediocre compared to the spacious and well-ventilated ones found in buildings like Blair.

column1: 4. My roommate and I organized the dorm into two bedrooms

column4: desk

column6: bookshelf
column7: television
column8: closet
column9: etc.).

column1: In conclusion
column2: if you are drawing in Mathey and would like a two-room double
column3: I strongly recommend 231 Joline. Otherwise
column4: there are better options
column5: especially outside of Mathey (e.g. Scully). Thus

column3: meaning that you have to suffer if some rando gets too cold.  remember heat rises so in the spring bring a fan.  "{"3"{"Foulke"{"327"{"112"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column2: it's comparitive (I think) in size to all other singles in Scully on THIS side of the hallway (odd numbers). Note

column4: \" instead

column1: 2009-07-24{"A pretty nice single room

column1: But what makes up for all of this is the balcony. Even if you don't use it too often

2010-02-23{"Previous review is accurate but it's worth noting that from October through February the room plays host to about 4 or five ladybugs a day and every so often a couple of large brownish beetles.  I have no idea how they get in (no obvious cracks or holes in mesh that covers the window
column2: except one that has been patched with duct tape) but they get in somehow and even if you try killing them or repeatedly taking them back outside (my choice as I don't like killing ladybugs) there are still always a decent number inhabiting the room.  It didn't bother me that much
column3: but I suppose it could really freak out some people who are scared of bugs or something.

column1: I also recommend
column2: if you live here
column3: that you put the bed in the alcove on the side of the room near the bathroom so that you free up more space in the room.  This does
column4: unfortunately
column5: block the spots to plug in ethernet and tv cables
column6: but I thought it was a worthwhile sacrifice because otherwise the strange shape of the room prevents you from having much space to move around.  "{"4"{"Lockhart"{"235"{"206"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"3"{"PU"

2011-02-28{"We split the room into two singles - one is smaller than the other so the bigger single doubled as the common room.

column3: or blocking the fireplace. Finally though we figured out how to fix the bed perpendicular to the window actually supported by the window seat (and a couple cinder blocks. It was very sturdy and worked out extremely well and we still had access to the majority of the window seat.

column1: There is a bathroom on the bottom floor - however it is a bit of a long walk (it's by entryway 1 whereas this room is entryway 4). The men's bathroom is slightly closer (entryway 3). There is also a very small kitchen (with sink

column3: stove and microwave) on the bottom floor for people who like to cook their own meals.

column1: Being on the ground floor was an adjustment. I really loved having the window shades open but people walking by are only two feet away from your window and can definitely see straight in. column1: 2011-03-01{"The first review is pretty much accurate...the square footage is definitely a lie. This room really should be a single.

Positives: Lofted storage space somewhat makes up for limited floorspace. Windows open up to the roof.  Beautiful view of the Mathey quad and Blair arch.  Bathrooms close by. Study area close by. Printer/kitchen/laundry directly downstairs.
Essentially

2011-03-01{"We got this room after being put on the waitlist
column2: and it is pretty much as expected for a waitlist room. The bedrooms in this room are TINY. you basically can't debunk the beds
column3: unless you are ok with your bed touching your roommate's bed. One of the bedrooms does have a bay window though
column4: which is a nice place to put your desk. the common room is a good size
column5: but it is awkwardly shaped. there are two fairly large closets
column6: but there are only 3 bars for hanging clothes (2 in one and 1 in the other)
column7: so someone doesn't get to hang their clothes. Also
column8: the closets are extremely awkwardly shaped and don't have any light source (and there are no outlets inside)
column9: so it's really hard to see inside when you're looking for something. On the topic of outlets
column10: this room is SEVERELY lacking in outlets: each bedroom only has 1
column11: and the common room only has 2 (on opposite sides of the room). We ended up using literally around a dozen extension cords to get everything plugged in in somewhere where it could be used. Also the room gets unbearably hot in the winter
column12: and the windows must be left open basically all the time
column13: except if you have your desk near a window
column14: in which case no matter how much you close the window it's still going to be freezing because the windows are very poorly insulated. The floors are also in really bad condition
column15: with large gaps between some of the tiles--stuff (e.g. vomit) gets stuck in them and are really hard to get out. The room is quite far from bathrooms: you either have to go up one flight of stairs and down a long hallway to use a tiny
column18: or down two flights of stairs to use a larger basement bathroom that is perpetually in a state of sustained filth. Basically
column19: avoid this room like the plague.

column1: It is however a decent party room
column2: since it is quite far from the RCA room (on a different floor and down a long hallway) and is already in terrible condition so parties can't make it any worse anyway. We probably hosted around a dozen parties throughout the year in this room
column3: and believe me

column1: 2013-02-28{"This room is pretty good--the common room is a good size and the window seat is nice. It's all about how you place your furniture. column2: the floor plan is wrong - this is right next to the girls not guys bathroom. Not that it makes too much a difference but on the floor plan they are switched.

column1: The room is L shaped and can be very small or decent sized depending how you situate things. We had space for a big tv
column2: subwoofer
column3: fridge
column4: futon
column5: and unbunked beds (though they are very close together and it would be better if one person lofted it) but there almost no open floor space otherwise.

column1: There were some centipedes in the first 2 weeks which made me nervous but there haven't really been any bugs since then through March.

It's 4th floor which is quieter but more walking. The room is one of the warmest on campus which can be either good or bad - we had a cold winter. The heater is on even if you turn the knob off so instead you have to open and close windows accordingly and use a fan when its hot out.
Other than that
column2: any room is what you make of it."{"4"{"Spelman"{"48"{"930"{"4"{"0"{"6"{"4"{"PR"

column1: 2015-03-19{"To complement and even reiterate the other two reviews below
column2: this room is beyond fantastic - it's unique in of its own with the turret addition. Put a round table in there and you can seat 15 people cozily for poker night without having taken up any actual room space...

column1: -There are a lot of windows which will help keep the room drafty during the warm months
column2: but on the colder side during the winter
column3: especially the turret
column4: which has poor insulation.

column1: -The bedrooms are extremely narrow
column2: so any efforts to try and debunk would not be worth it.

column1: -Furniture placement is very key to making this room the best it can be. There is an awkward fireplace mantle that can prevent this.
-There are a lot of house centipedes during the warm months. They usually disappear by late October and this is common to most Rocky rooms if not more.
-Noise from the music room: the room rests on top of the music room in the basement and you are guaranteed to hear whatever plays down there. However
column2: I personally have not had a problem with it in the bedroom and attempting to sleep.

column1: -Noise from the dumpster: EVERY morning
column2: the dump truck comes by around 9:30-11:00 am to empty the dumpsters on the side of Witherspoon. This involves a good 5-10 minutes of loud metal clashing and banging. If you are not a heavy sleeper
column3: this is your alarm clock because the dumpster is right there

column1: -Visibility: with the curtains up
column2: most adjacent 03 quads can see what's up in your room

column1: -Being on the first floor is quite convenient for the printer
column2: kitchen
column3: and exits

column1: -Bathrooms: in the 2014-2015 year
column2: the adjacent bathroom was women's and unfortunately we (men) were not able to change it
column3: so we had to walk across the hall to use the bathroom

column1: All that being said
column2: if you are being faced with the choice between this last turret room and ANY other quad in Rocky
column3: I strongly advise that you pick this room."{"4"{"Forbes Addition"{"A437"{"287"{"2"{"0"{"2"{"4"{"PU"

column3: trash as well. Both a tad bit far (trash room farther than laundry). It's pretty far (keeping in mind

column1: 2015-04-23{"Not the best room on campus
column2: but very standard for a freshman quad. The bedrooms are small (especially the left one) but the common room has enough space to fit a couple desks and a couch.

column1: It gets really hot in the early fall/late spring due to the southern sun. It's really close to the girls bathroom (and fairly close to the guys). Buyers is a fairly quiet dorm
column2: but this room is on one of the more social/connected hallways since it is on the second floor. "{"4"{"Forbes Addition"{"A268"{"175"{"1"{"1"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2015-04-23{"I loved this room so much!  It has a huge common room and a great layout - two of the bedrooms are smaller
column2: but that just encourages you to spend more time in the great common room with your awesome suite mates! We all put our desks in the common room
column3: as well as the extra bed as a couch (we only had seven people) - so it was perfect as a social hub
column4: but you can go in your room as well for privacy or quiet!  Living in this room made all of us
column5: who came in as freshman who didn't know each other
column6: such good friends and we are all living together next year as well!!!"{"5"{"Forbes Addition"{"A266"{"160"{"1"{"1"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2015-04-23{"Literally one of the best rooms in Whitman! Huge single (used to be a double)! Two sets of furniture and I pushed the two beds together to make a king size bed. Thermostat works. Tree right in front of windows so it's a little dark at times because there is not much natural sunlight. I had space in this room to ride my scooter around in circles. Not far from an unlocked visitor's bathroom
column2: and not all that far from the men's and women's restrooms either. In the south courtyard
column3: so you can get to the dining hall without leaving the building on cold days. I hope for your sake that they don't convert this room back to a double."{"5"{"Forbes Addition"{"A177"{"525"{"4"{"0"{"3"{"1"{"PU"

column1: 2015-04-23{"Great room

"{"4"{"Forbes Addition"{"A152"{"167"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"1"{"PU"

column1: 2015-04-23{"This is a great room that is routinely chosen as one of the last few singles in Mathey.  There were three singles left when I drew and I ended up really pleased with the result.  It's in Little
column2: which is a huge step up from Joline or Campbell

column4: but I managed to fit a TV
column5: a futon
column6: and a fridge within the framework of the room.  High ceilings make the room feel a lot bigger than it is and there's a gorgeous window/skylight facing the Little courtyard.  This skylight opens up onto a roof that one might
column7: if they were so inclined

column9: depending on how you arrange the room    "{"4"{"Forbes Addition"{"A149"{"158"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"1"{"PU"

column1: 2015-04-23{"Nothing really special about this placedon't draw here if you are a sophomore.  Common room is sizeable but the rooms are a little cramped.  You can debunk if you want to.  Joline just isn't a great dorm.  You'll have better luck in Blair

column1: 2015-07-16{"While at first the square footage seems smaller than other rooms in Wilson

column3: but this room is roughly a square. The room is big enough to debunk the beds and still have plenty of space. There is a (not in use) fireplace
column4: but it has no mantle piece
column5: so we just put one of the beds against it and used it as storage. There is an indent in the room (which doesn't make the room a square) that is the perfect size for one of the dressers. We put both desks against the furnace. The closet is on the small side
column6: but most college closets are like that. We have 5 gorgeous
column7: big windows
column8: but unfortunately being on the first floor we can easily hear the noise from outside. I recommend bringing a loud fan to drown out all outside noise. As a freshman

column1: 2015-07-24{"Could not have asked for a better room for sophomore year

column1: Blair is a really nice building to live in
column2: and entryway 8 is a great location. Bathrooms are right upstairs
column3: and there are more bathrooms downstairs (although the mens bathroom is kinda far downstairs). Kitchen
column4: laundry and study room are right downstairs as well. Building is very close to dining hall

column1: Pro tips
Get a lot of fans for the warm months because the room doesnt get a lot of circulation.
If getting a couch
column2: put it next to the window seat to get a sectional kind of seating area.

column1: If the light in the entry area bothers you at night
column2: put some dark colored duct tape over it. It comes off easily when moving out and fire safety shouldnt bother you about it.

column1: Our draw time was good but not great
column2: and I feel that this room was a real steal. Highly recommend!"{"5"{"Forbes Addition"{"A246"{"168"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2015-08-10{"Here's what I wish I knew when packing all my stuff for this room:

There is really only one wall that's completely usable for something the size of a bed because the other three are covered in doors and windows. Bunking is really the only option. The shade that's on the window makes the room really dark
column2: and people pass by it all the time so I would recommend a light-colored curtain instead. The room is also just kind of dark and dingy in general so get lots of lamps/lights. The bathroom is huge
column3: but it's also bare so you'll definitely need some shelves in there and in the shower. Also the shower head is weird so you can't hang a caddy over it; a tension corner shelf works better. Once you get all situated
column4: I think you'll love this room. I certainly did!

column1: Last but not least
column2: congratulations because this hall has some of the nicest rooms! Enjoy it while you can because this hall typically gets bad draw numbers for room selection in the spring."{"4"{"Forbes Addition"{"A244"{"168"{"1"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2015-09-21{"This room is a pleasant surprise. The L shaped configuration allows for the room to be divided in a way that ensures each roommate has his/her own private space within the shared room space. There is really PLENTY of space.

Both legs of the L have windows facing the Wilson courtyard. There is an open closet space with about 3 or 4 feet of closet rack for each roommate with two shelves above. The floors are wood cross-hatched squares. Normal cinderblock walls which can make Command Hooks a hassle. The window fits a box fan nicely. Noise in adjacent rooms or men's bathroom was not an issue. The dresser has 5 deep drawers. Desk has 3 drawers on the side with a long and shallow drawer in the middle.
I recommend placing the bookshelf on top of the dresser.
Ah
column2: this was a lot of information. Bottom line--Wilson is not horrible (at all)
column3: and this room is quite nice. "{"4"{"Forbes Addition"{"A261"{"167"{"1"{"1"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

2016-02-11{"This room definitely grows on you. It takes some work to get it set up just right

column1: 2016-02-12{"I agree with the previous posters. You likely have this as your freshman room. You are very lucky to have it. I do have three minor negatives:
1. Garbage trucks empty the dumpsters directly below this room early in the mornings. This can be a minor nuisance.
2. You will not be able to control the temperature. Usually
column2: it will be either too hot or too cold. Often significantly so. In my case it was usually too hot. I once forgot to crack my window and came back to an 81 degree Fahrenheit room.

column1: 3. If you are a male you will have to go either a floor up or a floor down for a men's room. This is not ideal.
In all though
column2: enjoy this spacious second floor room while you can.  You will be spoiled for next year; it is unlikely you will have a room (much less a single) this big or nice as a sophomore."{"5"{"Forbes Addition"{"A236"{"180"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2016-02-20{"There's not too much space in this room. At the same time if you're smart about how you use it you will get a lot out of it. My roommate and I had each of our beds on opposite sides of the room
column2: and took criss crossing desks
column3: so I had the left side of the room and the right desk that way if you're working late at night the light doesn't bother your roommate.

column1: The closets are pretty crappy
column2: you only get a small indent in the wall
column3: but each person also gets like four drawers which definitely helps.

column1: You can't really sprawl out that much
column2: but it's good for the basics
column3: watching movies on a tv just put the tv at the end of the room so you can watch from your bed
column4: and the desk area is kind of cozy. It's not a big desk area
column5: but these days with computers you don't really need a big space to write an essay
column6: cause you can have everything you need on your laptop.

column1: Some of the perks are there's a great lounge nearby on  this floor which makes for a great time hanging out with your floor-mates and your RCA.
The view in this room is also really nice.
It's a small room
column2: but I think if you have a good relationship with your roommate
column3: you'll be fine. I think it helps when you're willing to do stuff like studying at the library at least part of the time when your roommate is watching TV or vice versa.

column1: Also
column2: you're close to Nassau Street and Dillon Gym and the dining area.

column1: I feel like you gotta have good communication with your roommate in a room like this. "{"4"{"Forbes Addition"{"A234"{"180"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2016-02-22{"We set up this room as a double with a single. The single is very private and visitors usually thought it was just a closet door. The double has four windows with a nice view of the junior slums (hey
column2: they're pretty from the outside) and the single also has its own window. Very spacious and easy to entertain in
column3: though the stair gets a bit noisy at night. Both bathrooms are upstairs
column4: but you have the benefit of being right above the washing machines and study room. The slums are noisy on Thursday and Saturday nights
column5: but the noise isn't bad otherwise. We were on the last page of the draw times and I was surprised we got this nice of a room - apparently nobody draws for triples in Mathey."{"4"{"Forbes Addition"{"A214"{"180"{"2"{"0"{"1"{"2"{"PU"

column1: 2016-03-22{"Would highly recommend this room to sophomores! Lived there last year and we still miss it.
Pros:
-Awesome natural light: common room is all windows on one side
-one of the best views on campus/coolest rooms
-Both doubles de-bunk (put beds in L-shape) and both dressers fit in bedrooms
-Generously sized common room
-your room is cool enough that people will still visit despite the hike
Cons:
-3 flights of stairs
-bathroom is 2 floors down.
-substance free (good/bad depending on you)

column2: so this suite has a pretty nice common room and a bathroom. There are 5 rooms (3 doubles
column3: 2 singles). There is one room that is really narrow
column4: so what we did was we debunked the beds and moved one of them into the largest single. That meant that we ended up with one huge single
column5: but that room also shares a very thin wall with the common room
column6: which can get kind of loud from time to time. We kept all the desks from the doubles in the common room
column7: which took a little bit of arranging
column8: but ended up being pretty good. The doubles were comfortable (no way you can have debunked bed and desks in there though - we debunked
column9: but kept desks outside).

column1: There is a little balcony/emergency exit that we're not \"supposed\" to use
column2: but its really nice. The bathroom got kind of disgusting from time to time
column3: so just make sure you have a good cleaning schedule - we didn't. Great room for pregames and we all became really good friends
